lines.text: Brenda, I speak on behalf of your father, my beloved brother, that Morty is garbage, and it would be an honor to me to take him out.
[finding empty liquor bottles in trash]
Let's examine the evidence. Look! all bottles and gallon jugs!
I had guests!
Who? Guns N Roses?
Where's Shelly?
In the car.
Glove compartment?
Trunk.

My Morty becomes this big shot on T.V... He was selling electronics, right? On our 20th wedding anniversary it hits midlife crisis major. He starts working out, he, he grows a moustache, he gets an earring. I said, "Morty, Morty, what are you? A pirate? what's next? A parrot?" And all of a sudden I'm a big drag. I'm holding him back because I won't go rollerblading.
You think that because I'm a movie star I don't have feelings. Well you're wrong. I'm an actress. I've got all of them!
Ladies, you have to be strong and independent, and remember, don't get mad, get everything.
If I give you one more face lift you're going to be able to blink your lips!
What's wrong?
It's my lover. She left me for this younger woman that weighs twelve pounds.
That's just like my Morty.
Who?
Morty.
[Shows Woman her picture]
She's butch.
[Elise shows Bill proof that his new girlfriend is only sixteen years old]
Should have done your homework, Bill! I did. Oh, by the way, here's a copy of her birth certificate.
Oh, God... I didn't know... oh, God! Wh-what are you going to do?
Oh, what am I gonna do? Well, for now I'm just going to say the f word... *Felony*.
You've always been jealous of me, even in college! Because I was blonde and beautiful, and could have any guy I wanted!
Could and did! All the senior class and half the faculty!
It was the sixties.
Mom I'm a lesbian. But don't tell Daddy! I want to wait for a good time; like Father's Day or Christmas Morning!
There are only three ages for women in Hollywood - Babe, District Attorney, and Driving Miss Daisy.
[about her ex-husband's scantily clad date]
What's the matter, Morty? Can't you buy her a whole dress?

I'm very sorry I ever met you. And I'm sorry that I allowed myself to love you for all those years. I'm sorry that I did nothing but be there for you every minute of every hour and support you in your every *move*. I'm sorry!
[Upon seeing a slinky dress]

Now, I ask you, Duarto, who's supposed to wear that? Some anorexic teenager? Some fetus? It's a conspiracy, I know it is! I've had enough. I'm leading a protest. I'm not buying another article of clothing until these designers come to their senses!
I remember your first talk-y.
Oh yeah, what did you ever win? A pie eating contest? "Best digestion?"
Morty! Well, look at you. You look prosperous.
Brenda, don't embarrass me.

[Mocking Morty]
Don't embarrass you.
Don't make a scene.
Don't make a scene.
Do not make a scene.
Don't embarrass you! You've got a *nerve*! I'll tell you what's embarrassing!
Keep your voice down.
Being hassled by Mr. Zaworsky... because I'm behind in the rent, *that's* embarrassing. Worrying about how I'm gonna get my kid through college, *that's* embarrassing!
You know something? You *never* listen. For twenty years you never ever listened. Here,
[grabs a yellow blouse]
honey why don't you try this one in a fitting room, looks very nice on you.
You know, I could use this. It's very beautiful and I love the color. But what am I gonna to use for money? HOW AM I GONNA PAY FOR IT?
It's the *company* that is expanding. Don't you understand that? The *company*, not *me*! I'm a mere laborer!
You're a liar and a FRAUD!
I have no money.
Really? Why don't you look in your purse?
Oh you're very funny.
There stunning Morton, I need all of them.
Morton?

[covers her face with a dress]
Oh God, make it go away.
Shelly! Look at you! My my, the bulimia certainly has paid off.
Don't start.
What's a matter Morty? Can't you buy her a whole dress?
Brenda, why don't you try these on in
[holds out her arms]
*your size*!
It's really a delight running into you today Brenda.
Shelly, what happened here? $140,00 for a PLATE? $47,000 for a carpet? A USED carpet? $300,00 for a Lamborghini? Are you crazy?
I bought the car for you! It was only 300 grand! It was a GIFT!
With my money you bought it! I bought me the gift!
Jesus, Morty, all I want is a lifestyle, y'know - with some ambiance and some classic eternal good taste!
I can't handle more surprises today.
Oh, Daddy. I'm a lesbian. A big one.
There she is. Princess Pelvis!
No, Sean Connery is Monique's boyfriend! He may be three hundred years old, but he's still a stud!
I drink because I am a sensitive and highly strung person.
No, that's why your co-stars drink.
Elise, if I give you any more collagen, your lips are gonna look like they got stuck in a pool drain.
I'll sue you, I'll *break* you! You vindictive sack of silicone! That's my car, you piece of plastic!
Let's synchronize our watches.
Impossible!"
Oh, that was a big hit.
I'm not Monique's Mother!
No.
Angela Lansbury's Monique's Mother!
Uh-huh.
Shelley Winters is Unique's mother!
Now that's a good one.
Sean Connery is Monique's mother!
And I'm going to get you some coffee.
Hi, I'm Phoebe. I've seen all your movies and I want to be just like you. Only, me!
What if Elise starts drinking again and then you start sniping away?
Been there!
Done that!
Those lips - what's in 'em? Are they wax?
Doormat!
Lesbian!
When men know women are a certain age...
Good bye love.
Hello pop-tarts.
I'm saying this, with love compassion and the spirit of true sisterhood... you are full of SHIT!
Whhhaaattt?

[of her salad dressing]
Normally I bring my own. You know that fat free ranch stuff. But this, this is restaurant quality.
Nice car, used to have one myself.
Thanks. So, what's going on in there? Is it just a lot of battered women dancing around or what?
Yeah, sort of. Not really my scene.
Me neither.
So, are you here with anybody?
Not really.
How old are you?

[upon seeing an "unnaturally" young Elise walk into Cynthia's funeral]
She looks fabulous; do you think she's had work done?

[rancorously]
Honey, she's a quilt!
If only she'd called me. If only I was listed.
[Gunilla sees Shelly and Morty re-entering the apartment and dials her phone. Duarto answers]
Social climbers on the rise.
Leave me alone. One hour. One hour. One hour, thank YOU!
I'm unhappy, Maurice!
And I'm going to get you that coffee.
Annie, you choose. Who's your friend? Me or Brenda?
Yeah, for once in your life make a decision? Who's your friend? Some Beverly Hills science project?
Or a woman with her own aisle at the supermarket?
Wake up and smell the audit!

[Drunk]
You never even wrote to me!

[Meekly]
You were unlisted...
And you always talked about me behind my back!
Oh, you deserved it!

[having a panic attack]
I'm clean! I'm clean! I'm clean!
[Brenda and Elise whack her over the head with some file folders]

So okay, alimony sucks. Okay, you didn't get to play a police woman in a wonder bra. But look at you, you're gorgeous! And thanks to Cher's pioneering efforts you still haven't hit puberty! And once upon a time you *were* a terrific actress! You've even got an Oscar to prove it! You've spent your whole life with people *sucking* up to you! I'm sure Annie will agree with me when I say that *your* perception of life is *somewhat altered*!
Oh, Daddy. I'm a lesbian. A big one.
My, my, the bulimia has certainly paid off.
You are married. You have a daughter. You don't need self-esteem.
It's the 90s, plastic surgery is like good grooming.
Brenda, why don't you try on one of these in *your size*?
Gunilla Garson Goldberg, personally inviting me to one of her super-social luncheons!
Why?
Ya know I wonder how drunk Cynthia was when she decided to do a jack knife off Park Avenue.
And you didn't even invite me to your son's bar mitzvah!
I didn't think you would come.
Yeah, it was in Hebrew!
Oh shutup!
